title: Hollywood has lost one of television's most recognizable game show hosts. Who was Tom Kennedy? - Quora

response.answer_text: Tom Kennedy was most famous for the game shows, Name That Tune, Split Second, “Whew! “ and Body Language in the mid 1989s. He also hosted several other game shows as well. Tom was also a part time actor, having done small roles on the TV shows That Girl, Hardcastle & McKormick, Cannon & others. Plus a role as a “Ticket Seller” in the 1985 Harrison Ford film “Witness”. Tom was born in February of 1927 and passed on October 7th, 2020 at age 93. I was only a kid In the 1970s when I watched Name That Tune, Split Second and ,”Whew” but I never forgot these shows and tthe unique look and manner Tom had when he was host. I didn't know the songs on Name That Tune but, still, he made ithe show worth paying attention too. RIP Tom Kennedy

Tom Kennedy was one of network television’s most prolific personalities focusing primarily on game shows.  He began his career on local radio, having worked at Lexington, KY’s own WKLX. A rare B&W photo below captures Kennedy’s presence in local media.
